intro: Hieracium uiginskyense, commonly known as the Uiginsky hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Hieracium. It grows in dry, open habitats such as steppes and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
